intro: Viola rhodosepala, commonly known as the pink-sepaled violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces showy flowers with violet petals and distinctive pink sepals. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 centimeters and blooms in late spring to early summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded woodland areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in temperate climates.
